metadata.title: Implement Invoice Email Template, Send Service, and Send Endpoint

context.background: This task implements Implement Invoice Email Template, Send Service, and Send Endpoint for Healio and is scoped as one atomic work item aligned to the PRD. It should be completed within 45 mins and leave clear evidence for follow-on tasks.

design_constraints.constraint: Use Stripe-like frictionless workflows: create/edit actions should open centered modals or slide-out drawers instead of disruptive full-page forms.
Use a Viedoc-style bento layout: soft floating white cards on an off-white background for dashboards and dense data views.
Apply the Paper Replacement palette: app background near #F9FAFB, white cards, calm trustworthy accents (teal/sage/cerulean), and reserve red for critical alerts only.
Preserve high-legibility typography: clean sans-serif (Inter/SF Pro/Halyard), bold patient names, slate-gray secondary metadata.
Honor the one-click rule where applicable: keep the global + action for Add Appointment, Add Patient, and Create Invoice visible and easy to reach.
Add educational empty states with clear CTAs for first-time or empty datasets.

instruction.step: Implement the scoped changes for Implement Invoice Email Template, Send Service, and Send Endpoint in the planned files (healio/emails/invoice.tsx, healio/lib/resend.ts, healio/services/notificationService.ts, healio/app/api/v1/invoices/[id]/send/route.ts) while preserving the PRD-aligned project structure.
Apply validation, error handling, and consistent response/UI behavior so the task output integrates cleanly with existing helpers and patterns.
Wire integrations and dependencies for this task (endpoints: POST /api/v1/invoices/:id/send) and keep tenant scoping/RBAC/security expectations intact where applicable.
Prefer in-context modal/drawer workflows, scannable bento cards, and educational empty states so the UI matches the requested Healio experience.
Verify keyboard/focus behavior, touch target sizing, and mobile responsiveness before marking the task ready.

validation_checklist.check: Exercise the related endpoint(s): POST /api/v1/invoices/:id/send and verify response shape/status codes.
Run lint/typecheck or the smallest relevant test suite for the files changed by this task.
Manually verify desktop and mobile layouts plus focus/keyboard behavior for the primary interaction path.
Use Chrome DevTools MCP to verify the implemented UI in-browser (desktop + mobile), check interactions, inspect console errors, and capture a validation snapshot before marking done.
Capture a screenshot or short note confirming empty/loading/error states are present where applicable.

acceptance_criteria.criterion: The deliverable for Implement Invoice Email Template, Send Service, and Send Endpoint is implemented in the referenced files and compiles without breaking adjacent modules.
Task output matches the PRD scope (Feature 4 send endpoint; Feature 5 notifications) and remains bounded to an atomic <=45-minute implementation chunk.
Related endpoint behavior returns the standard success/error envelope and respects auth/public route expectations for the route class.
UI states (loading, empty, error, success) are present and visually consistent with Healio bento cards, off-white background, and trust-oriented styling.
Interactions are keyboard accessible and usable on mobile without disruptive navigation when a modal/drawer workflow is appropriate.

execution_tracking.verification_command: npm run typecheck; node --import tsx --test tests/unit/invoice-send-route.test.ts; Chrome DevTools MCP evaluate_script fetch calls for POST /api/v1/invoices/:id/send
execution_tracking.verification_notes: Implemented invoice email send flow with a lightweight invoice email template, Resend adapter wrapper (runtime lazy import + fallback), notification service email send integration using idempotency (`invoice-send:{invoiceId}`), and protected `POST /api/v1/invoices/:id/send`. Endpoint generates/ensures a pay link first, sends via Resend fallback in local mode, and records notification status transitions.

evidence.item: When work starts/completes, record changed files, test commands, screenshots (UI tasks), and commit/PR references here.
Include Chrome DevTools MCP evidence (snapshot/screenshot reference and notes on responsive + interaction checks) here before marking frontend tasks complete.

Changed files: healio/emails/invoice.tsx, healio/lib/resend.ts, healio/services/notificationService.ts, healio/app/api/v1/invoices/[id]/send/route.ts, healio/tests/unit/invoice-send-route.test.ts, healio/tsconfig.tsbuildinfo.
`emails/invoice.tsx` renders invoice send subject/html/text content with pay-link CTA and billing summary details using a PRD-aligned clean, legible card style.
`lib/resend.ts` provides `sendEmailWithResend` with runtime lazy import and local fallback response when `RESEND_API_KEY` or SDK is unavailable.
`notificationService.ts` now includes `sendInvoiceEmailNotificationForClinic` which queues notification records with idempotency, sends via Resend adapter, and marks SENT/FAILED state accordingly.

`POST /api/v1/invoices/:id/send` validates tenant-scoped invoice/patient lookup, requires patient email, ensures a pay link exists (via HEALIO-046 service), renders the email template, and returns send metadata (notification/provider/replay flags).
Route tests: `node --import tsx --test tests/unit/invoice-send-route.test.ts` passed (send success, idempotent replay, pay-link persistence/status, invalid id, missing email, tenant mismatch).

Chrome DevTools MCP endpoint verification (on `http://localhost:4012/billing` via `evaluate_script`): created patient+invoice, called `POST /api/v1/invoices/:id/send` twice, observed `200/200` with second response `replayed=true`, provider `resend-fallback`, `notificationStatus=SENT`, and checkout URL present. Network log shows send endpoint requests `345` and `346`, both `200`; console check only React DevTools info.
Implementation commit: a258b5e (feat(healio-billing): invoice email send flow).
